definition: ghost/demon/terrible/damnable/clever/sly/crafty/(suffix for sb with a certain vice or addiction etc)/one of the 28 constellations

sentences.english: Are driven, like ghosts from an enchanter fleeing.
sentences.chinese: 犹如巫师吓得鬼魅纷纷溃离。

sentences.english: Mustangs are an after image of the west, no better than ghosts, hardly there at all.
sentences.chinese: 而野马就是西部残留影象，犹如鬼魅，几乎不见踪影。

sentences.english: Underlying millennium pullbacks haughty ghosts haughty.
sentences.chinese: 潜藏千年邪气高傲高傲的鬼魅。

sentences.english: True love is like ghosts, which everyone talks about and few have seen.
sentences.chinese: 真爱如同鬼魅，每个人都谈论它，却很少有人见到。

sentences.english: Unemployment is still in the stratosphere and shows no sign of improving.
sentences.chinese: 失业问题依然鬼魅般如影随形，并且没有好转的迹象。

definition: be high up in the sky
lit. to appear and disappear unpredictably like a spirit or a ghost (idiom)/fig. elusive
lit. a meteor catching up with the moon/swift action (idiom)
pose or motion of one's body in martial arts
wordless and uncommunicative (idiom); without speaking/taciturn/not providing any news
